title.narrative: Femmes et Energies Durables au Sahel - RM

description.narrative: Op2.1. Selected women’s groups are structured into Women’s Led SE Enterprises (WLSEEs) : 1,230 members of 16 women’s groups sensitized on the added value of SET and on the structuring and functioning of a WLSEE; 12 Savings and Loans Schemes (SLS) established/strengthened; 7 WLSEEs (21 employees) - 6 WLSEEs processing vegetables (2 WLSEEs), rice (2 WLSEEs), and milk (2 WLSEEs) and 1 solar shop - structured and officially registered. Op2.2. Established WLSEEs and individual women have access to financial services: 5 women’s groups and 7 WLSEEs have access to 893,247 EUR. Op2.3. Financed WLSEEs and women can use and maintain introduced SET:5 women’s groups and 7 WLSEEs equipped with solar and/or biogas powered technologies; 20 women working within the 6 WLSEEs trained on the use and maintenance of their respective SET; 5 local technicians trained on the maintenance of introduced SET Op2.4. Established WLSEEs have strengthened business skills and relationships
